NA35-d-06-12-90-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 871-07 WITH UNITS 6028-6052, O LOADS, 91 EMPTIES, 2673 TONS, WASMADE UP AT GLENWOOD, MN, MILEPOST 120.0, WITH THE OUTBOUND CREW ONBOARD. THE ENGINEER WAS GOING TO ADD UNIT 6408 TO THEIR CONSIST.ENGINEER TOOK UNIT 6408 DOWN TO THE EAST END OF YARD TRACK #10 AND WAS GOING TO WAIT FOR TRAIN 943-11 TO LEAVE GLENWOOD YARD FROM THE NEW MAIN TRACK THROUGH TO THE CROSSOVER AND INTO THE PASS. DEPARTING TRAIN 943-11 HAD UNITS 6008-4002-6013 WITH 46 LOADS, 67 EMPTIES, 6853 TONS. ENGINEER COULD NOT STOP UNIT 6408 ON ACCOUNT OF THE BRAKES FAILING. HE THEN APPLIED HAND BRAKES, BUT COULD NOT STOP THEENGINE IN TIME TO PREVENT SIDESWIPING TRAIN 943-11. ENGINE 6408 SIDESWIPED THREE LOADS OF PIPE; JTTX550361 WHICH WAS 78TH FROM THE HEAD END OF 943-11'S TRAIN, JTTX501850 WHICH WAS 79TH FROM THE HEADEND AND CP 315513 WHICH WAS 80TH FROM THE HEAD END. ENGINE 6408 NOR THE THREE SIDESWIPED CARS DERAILED,BUT SUBSTANTIAL DAMAGE WAS SUSTAINED. UPON INVESTIGATION, IT WAS FOUND THAT THE BRAKES ON UNIT 6408 DID NOT WORK BECAUSE THE RESERVOIR WAS 'T PUTTING OUT ANY AIR, AND THE ENGINEER FAILED TO NOTICE.NoneNoneNoneNone

DUE TO TRAIN LENGTH, TRACK CURVATURE AND WOODED AREAS, THE TRAIN CREW CONTINUED TO BEANABLE TO DETECT THE DERAILED CARS; THEY WERE DRAGGED NORTH FOR APPROXIMATELY 2/10TH OF A MILE UNTIL THEY RERAILED THEMSELVES AT A SWITCH NORTH OF LUDLOW STATION (APPROXIMATE MILEAGE 27.3). A MOTORIST WHO HAD SEEN THE DERAILED CARS BEING DRAGGED ALONG FLAGGED THE TRAIN DOWN AT MARTELL'S CROSSING (MILEAGE 27.65).NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

NA32-d-06-16-90-SOO.Narrative: ON A WARM CLOUDY AFTERNOON THE 2:30 PM FORD JOB WAS HEADED EAST TOWARDS ST PAUL YARD, MOVING AT APPROXIMATELY 4 MPH AT MILEPOST 412.0 DAVERNAVENUE WITH UNITS 1508-1504 AND 49 LOADS, 18 EMPTIES, NO CABOOSE, WHEN ETTX 853100 PICKED THE SWITCH AT THE WEST END OF DAVERN AVENUE, DERAILING ITSELF AND THENEXT SIX CARS WEST OF IT. ALL CARS REMAINED UPRIGHT, BUT EACH SUSTAINED SOME DAMAGE, AND THERE WAS CONSIDERABLE TRACK DAMAGE AS WELL. THE DERAILED CARS WERE 12TH THROUGH 18TH FROM THE HEADEND. THE FIRST FIVE DERAILED CARS WERE EMPTIES, WHILE THE SIXTH AND SEVENTH DERAILED CARS WERE LOADS OF NEW FORDPICKUPS. THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO ANY OF THE LADING. UPON INVESTIGATION IT WAS FOUND THAT THERE WAS NO SWITCH LOCK IN THE VICINITY, SO THE ROADMASTER ARRANGED TO HAVEONE PUT ON. CREW MEMBERS PERFORMEDTHEIR DUTIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE RULES AND REGULATIONS AND WERE NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DERAILMENT, THEREFORE NO DISCIPLINE WAS ASSESED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

NA30-d-06-08-90-SOO.Narrative: ON A COOL RAINY MORNING FREIGHT TRAIN 114 ARRIVED AT AGATE, NORTH DAKOTA WITH LITE ENGINES 4510, 4003, 4509, 4434 AND PICKED UP FIVE CARS OFGRAIN OFF THE HOUSE TRACK, THEN PULLLED OUT, PIT EOT DEVICEON REAR CAR AND MADE AIR TEST. REAR BRAKEMAN WALKED UP WHEN BRAKES WERE APPLIEDAND GOT ON ONE UNIT TO ASSIST ENGINEER SINCE IT WAS NOT WORKING PROPERLY. THEY WANTED TO CHECK UNIT OUT UNDER LOAD, SO WENT TO BACK UP A SHORT DISTANCE. HEAD BRAKEMAN HAD ADDED THE EOT DEVICE AND DISCUSSED ENGINE PROBLEMSAND MOVEMENT TO BE MADE WITH THE HEAD END. HEAD BRAKEMAN WAS STANDING ALONG REAR CAR JUST EAST OF THE SWITCH, BUT FORGOT TO LINE THE SWITCH BACK SO AS THE TRAIN BACKED INTO THE HOUSE TRACK, TWO CARSWENT OVER THE DERAIL. UNDER SOO POLICY, HEAD BRAKEMAN WAS UHR TESTED (BLOOD AND URINE) WITH RESULTSSHOWING NEGATIVE. A FORMAL INVESTIGTION/HEARING WA SCHEDULED AND THEN CANCELLELD WITH THE FOLLOWINGDISCIPLINE AESSED: HEAD BRAKEMAN SIGNED A WAIVER FOR FIVE DAYS SUSPENSIONWITH TWO-DAYS ACTUAL SUSPENSION AND 3-DAYS DEFERRED SUSPENSION.NoneNoneNoneNone

TRAIN 223-04 SIDESWIPED MILW 100647, A LOAD OF CORN THAT WAS ON NO.6 TRACK IN THE DUBUQUE YARD, CAUSING IT TO TIP OVER ONTO THE MAIN TRACK, SPILLING PART OF IT'S LOAD. 061290A-d-06-12-90-ATK.Narrative: ON JUNE 12, 1990, CONRAIL FREIGHT WAHA-23 WITH CONRAIL ENGINE 1969 WITH 15 LOADS AND ZERO EMPTIES WENT ON DUTY IN HARTFORD AT 5:00 PM. SUBSEQUENTLY THEY LEFT HARTFORD AN 10:00 PM., FOR SWITCHING IN WALLINGFORD YARD. THE LAST SIGNAL AT WALL WAS APPROACH AND THEY PULLED INTO THE YARD AFTER LINING THESWITCH FROM NO.5 TRACK TO NO.3 TRACK. AFTER 11 CARS CLEARED THE SWITCH THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. AFTER INSPECTING THE TRAIN THE CREW FOUND THE 12TH AND 13TH CARS DERAILED APPROXIMATELY 50 FEET FROM THE SWITCH. THE TRAIN WAS BEING PULLED IN A SOUTH DIRECTION. UPON INSPECTION BY THE COMMITTEE ITWAS DISCOVERED THAT THE SWITCH POINT WAS BROKEN DURING THE MOVEMENT. THE DEFECT BEING IN THE POINT ITSELF. WHEEL FLANGES ON THE DERAILED EQUIPMENT AND PROCEEDING CARS WERE FOUND TO BE IN TOLERANCE. THE CONRAIL OPERATING CREW WERE OBSERVED BY AMTRAK SUPERVISION WITH NO EXCEPTIONS TAKEN, THEREFORE, ITWAS DETERMINED THAT REASONABLE CAUSE TESTING WAS NOT JUSTIFIED UNDER OUR OWN AUTHORITY.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
